meanings.definition: The state of being private or secret.
meanings.sent1: She kept her diary in the privities of her bedroom.
meanings.sent2: The privities of the meeting were not to be disclosed.
meanings.sent3: The cat's favorite privities were under the bed.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were hidden in the privities of his mind.
meanings.sent5: The treasure was buried deep in the privities of the forest.

meanings.sent1: The family discussed their privities behind closed doors.
meanings.sent2: She shared her privities with her best friend.
meanings.sent3: The privities of the surprise party were well-kept.
meanings.sent4: His heart held many privities that he never shared.
meanings.sent5: The book contained the privities of the ancient civilization.

meanings.sent1: The garden was her favorite privities for reading.
meanings.sent2: He found solace in the privities of the library.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's privities for storing nuts were cleverly hidden.
meanings.sent4: The cave served as a privities for the band of outlaws.
meanings.sent5: The attic was a mysterious privities full of forgotten treasures.
